kodkod.engine.satlab
Class MiniSAT

java.lang.Object
  kodkod.engine.satlab.MiniSAT
All Implemented Interfaces:
SATSolver
public final class MiniSAT
extends java.lang.Object
implements SATSolver

The wrapper class for the MiniSAT solvers (org.sat4j.specs.ISolver).

Author:
Emina Torlak

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int seconds)
Sets the timeout of this solver to the specified number of seconds. If a solution is not found in the given timeframe, the solver terminates with a TimeoutException.

Specified by:
setTimeout in interface SATSolver
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - seconds < 0
See Also:
SATSolver.setTimeout(int)
effects:
sets the timeout to the given number of seconds

addVariables

public void addVariables(int numVars)
Adds the specified number of new variables to the solver's vocabulary.

Specified by:
addVariables in interface SATSolver
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - numVars < 0
effects:
this.literals' = [1..#this.literals + numVars]

addClause

public void addClause(int[] lits)
Adds the specified sequence of literals to this.clauses. No reference to the specified array is kept, so it can be reused.

Specified by:
addClause in interface SATSolver
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - lits = null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - some i: [0..lits.length) | |lits[0]| > #this.literals
See Also:
SATSolver.addClause(int[])
effects:
this.clauses' = this.clauses + lits

solve

public boolean solve()
              throws TimeoutException
Returns true if there is a satisfying assignment for this.clauses. Otherwise returns false. If this.clauses are satisfiable, the satisfying assignment can be obtained by calling variablesThatAre(boolean, int, int) or valueOf(int).

Specified by:
solve in interface SATSolver
Returns:
true if this.clauses are satisfiable; otherwise false.
Throws:
TimeoutException - - the solver could not determine the satisfiability of the problem within this.timeout() seconds.

variablesThatAre

public IntSet variablesThatAre(boolean truthValue,
                               int start,
                               int end)
Returns the literals in the range [start..end] that have been set to the given boolean value by the most recent call to solve().

Specified by:
variablesThatAre in interface SATSolver
Returns:
the true literals between start and end
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - start > end || [start..end] !in this.literals
java.lang.IllegalStateException - - solve() has not been called or the outcome of the last call was not true.

valueOf

public java.lang.Boolean valueOf(int literal)
Returns the truth value assigned to the given literal by the most recent call to solve(). If the value of the given literal did not affect the result of the last solution, null is returned.

Specified by:
valueOf in interface SATSolver
Returns:
the value of the given literal
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - literal !in this.literals
java.lang.IllegalStateException - - solve() has not been called, or the call terminated with an exception.
See Also:
SATSolver.valueOf(int)
